name: Estate of Charles Baeder, deceased. Appeal of Emily Baeder Shirk

judges: Before Green, Williams, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ., on argument. Before Sterrett, C. J.,, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ., on reargument.
parties: Estate of Charles Baeder, deceased. Appeal of Emily Baeder Shirk.

opinions.text:
Opinion isy
Mr. Justice Mitchell,
This case involves the same question and is determined by the decision in Baeder’s Estate, Baeder’s Appeal, ante, p. 606.
Decree reversed as to appellant, and distribution directed to be amended in accordance with this opinion.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Mitchell,

attorneys: J. Rodman Paul, with him Biddle ¿- Ward, for appellant.
Richard C. Bale, with him James P. Townsend, William Henry Lex and George Junhin, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Estate of Charles Baeder, deceased. Appeal of Emily Baeder Shirk.
Argued Feb. 2, 1897.
Reargued, Jan. 31, 1899.
Appeal, No. 564, Jan. T., 1896, by Emily Baeder Shirk, from decree of O. C. Montgomery Co., Oct. T.,1896, No. 101, overruling exceptions to auditor’s report.
Before Green, Williams, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ., on argument. Before Sterrett, C. J.,, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ., on reargument.
Reversed.
J. Rodman Paul, with him Biddle ¿- Ward, for appellant.
Richard C. Bale, with him James P. Townsend, William Henry Lex and George Junhin, for appellee.
April 10, 1899:
